intro: Cyperus rarissimus, commonly known as the rare spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and cylindrical flower clusters. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia, and thrives in wetland environments. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense colonies that help stabilize aquatic ecosystems. Its slender, spike-like inflorescences are composed of numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyperus rarissimus is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
